title: Arithmetic Evaluation
text: Evaluate a parenthesized expression of single-digit positive integers and the binary operators +, -, *.The order of operations differs from the canonical one in that operations have no precedence; they are simply evaluated from left-to-right, with only parentheses affecting the order of evaluation.Every intermediate step is guaranteed to have absolute value no greater than 1,000,000,000.Input:Input is an arithmetic expression of single-digit positive integers, the binary operators +, -, * and parentheses ( ). The arithmetic expression will be well-formed and will have no spaces.Output:The evaluated value of the arithmetic expression.Example Input 1:Example Input 2:Example Input 3:1*2+11+1*2(5*6)-(4+(1))Example Output 1:Example Output 2:Example Output 3:3425
